message.content:
To get to the grocery store that is 1km away in Armenia, you have a few options:

1. Walking: If the weather is pleasant and you enjoy walking, you can simply walk to the grocery store. It will take you approximately 10-15 minutes to cover a distance of 1km.

2. Cycling: If you have a bicycle or can rent one, cycling can be a convenient and quick way to reach the grocery store. It will take you around 5-7 minutes to cover the distance.

3. Public transportation: Check if there are any buses or minibusses (known as marshrutkas) that pass by or near the grocery store. You can ask locals or check online for the bus routes and schedules. This option may take a bit longer due to stops and traffic.

4. Taxi: If you prefer a more comfortable and direct option, you can take a taxi to the grocery store. Taxis are usually readily available in most areas, and the ride should be relatively short and affordable.

Consider the weather, your preferences, and the availability of transportation options to choose the most suitable method for your trip to the grocery store.
